meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

I just got back from the Cryptmaster underground dungeon crawler, and I'm still reeling from the experience! Now, I know what you're thinking - another indie game trying to revolutionize the genre. Well, let me tell you, this one's got some tricks up its sleeve.

First off, the visuals are top-notch. The black-and-white pencil-sketching is not only visually stunning but also pays homage to the classic wireframe environments of Wizardry (or should I say, Wire-fray?). It's like stepping into a dark, mysterious cave where the only light comes from the flickering torches of your imagination.

Now, let's talk about the gameplay. Cryptmaster challenges you to tap into your inner linguist and typing master. Yeah, you read that right - it's all about the words! With a vocabulary-based mechanic that requires you to decipher ancient texts, decode cryptic messages, and even solve puzzles using wordplay, this game is not for the faint of heart.

But hey, who needs combat when you can have clever wordplay? I mean, seriously, have you ever tried to describe the perfect sandwich to someone over the phone? It's like trying to explain the meaning of life without any actual words. That's what Cryptmaster does - it takes that frustration and turns it into an art form.

Of course, not everyone will share my enthusiasm (looking at you, Slant Magazine). Some folks might find the real-time typing a bit...fiddly. But hey, that's just part of the charm! It's like trying to solve a crossword puzzle blindfolded while being attacked by goblins.

What I love about Cryptmaster is its willingness to be different. It's not your typical dungeon crawler with swords and shields; it's an edutainment game that will make you laugh, cry (from frustration), and maybe even learn something new.

So, if you're looking for a game that will challenge your linguistic skills, tickle your funny bone, and keep you engaged for hours on end, then Cryptmaster is the perfect choice. Just don't say I didn't warn you...
